author: brianlee
title: Global Sustainable Indep. SPO's
description: How can we promote a decentralised, globally distributed and sustainable pool of operators to run the Cardano network

f6_assessments.q0:
Disclaimer: my view points are shaped by my multi-year experience in product management and software development.

The prorosal aims to increase the number of independent stake pool operators, which supports then Fund 8 goal of growing the number of contributors.

At the same time, the proposal does not provide a detailed analysis of the current state of the SPO ecosystem:
1) what is the current level of centralization?
2) how big is a typical SPO?
3) what's the current growth rate of new SPOs?

In addition, the proposal does not present a rationale why the requested funds would be sufficient to have a noticeable impact on the problem.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point because this objective supports only one of three strategic goals of Fund 8.
- 1 point for the lack of a clear analysis of the problem.
- 1 point for the lack of a discusion of the ability to achieve a noticeable impact.
My rating is 2.
f6_assessments.q1:
The Cardano community has all the neccesary skills for launching/maintaining Stake Pool Operators.

At the same time, the proposal mentions that without dedicated support smaller SPOs will struggle against the bigger ones. This raises a question: is there a chance that this is a problem with the design of incentives? If yes, then no number of short-term support activites will fix the issue.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of discussion of the underlying causes of the issue, making it possible that the funds won't have a noticeable impact.
- 1 point for the challenge team out ouf one member, reducing the ability to support and provide advice to participants.
My rating is 3.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposed metrics (geographical diversity, funds staked, unique hosting providers) do help to track progress of the initiative.

At the same time, they do not provide insights into the raised underlying problem (centralization, stability), so to make progress more verifiable, I'd suggest to consider the following metrics:
1) Decentralization: The % of all staked resources that come from small (less than 1% of all resources) SPOs.
2) Small SPOs viability: the ROI of SPOs depending on its scale (small, medium, large). This should help insure that incentives are set right.
3) The satisfaction of the small SPO Cardano community vs that in alternative ecosystems.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluting the impact on Cardano ecosystem.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluting user satisfaction and the competitiveness of the solutions.
My rating is 3.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge question is aligned with the general Cardano mission, as decentralization is the most important goal for sustainable network.
f6_assessments.q1: I am familiar with few independant mission focused pools, SPO's who's principles are to be independent, running their own servers. The community understands troubles stated in this challenge, as this is an ongoing process for decentralized ecosystem.  I would like to suggest to include factual data for the statements about larger hosting providers and statements about energy consumption.
f6_assessments.q2:
It seems that the metrics are directed towards this challenge in general and not towards future proposals. 
My suggestion is to develop the metrics around incentives that this challenge is proposing.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge aligns with Fund 8 Strategic Goal of prepare a group of people willing and able to make contributions to the ecosystem. To improve challenge: better articulate how the challenge aligns with more than 1 of the Fund 8 Strategic Goals.
f6_assessments.q1: There is overlap between this proposal and another SPO related challenge however their combined budget request is only $800K, which is not unreasonable given the total budget and previous demand. Voters wishing to support only one of these SPO challenges may want to choose this one since it existed in the previous fund and has the larger budget.
f6_assessments.q2: Success criteria and metrics are excellent for measuring progress.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a valuable challenge proposal. In the current funding round it has already been shown that there's high interest in it, so it sure should be continued. Furthering concepts to make staking and thus blockchain transactions more sustainable is clearly both of general societal benefit and part of Cardanos mission. Also, it supports the goal of decentralisation. The challenge also supports the oal of decentralisation.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is open enough to support a variety of solutions while sticking to a general framework. The challenge team should be competent to manage this challenge as they are operating a stakepool themselves. There should be no issues delivering prposals in this challenge in the commonly used timeframes.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics are set up well and match the type and content of the challenge. They give proposers some criteria they can orient their planning on.

importance: A globally distributed self-reliant network is the best defense against a number of major threats to the network
success: A diverse and healthy ecosystem of stake pool operators from around the globe collectively run the network on a multitude of infrastructures
